title: How to Make the Most out of Your Flickr Account

steps.headline: Get a Flickr account if you don't already have one.
Work on personalizing your Flickr account.
Find your people on Flickr.
steps.description: These could be people you know, or people with similar interests.

steps.headline: Scan your comments.
steps.description: Check out the users accounts that are checking you out.

steps.headline: Join groups.
steps.description:
Search Flickr for groups that are interested in things you like and join them. Some great ones are:

Strobist, which could possibly have local groups that share their knowledge of strobe lighting and offer examples. DIY groups.

steps.headline: Use the Flickr Upload.
steps.description: This tool makes it a lot easier to get the images online.

steps.headline: Get a Pro account.
Edit/Share individual pics!.
steps.description:
Add Note  Add a note to the image - Any images on Flickr as a registered user
Send to group  Send to group - Share your images with groups that you belong to. Add to set  If you have sets, you can add a picture to a particular one. Blog this  You can blog a photo - Any images on Flickr as a registered user
All sizes  View the photo in whichever sizes it has been uploaded. If only one size has been uploaded, you won't see this option
Order prints  Order prints of your images. Rotate  Rotate your image. Edit photo  Edit your photo using Picnik. Delete  Delete the photo. Add this photo to your 'faves'. This will be on other Flickr members photos.

steps.headline: Check out your stats.
steps.description: You can see which of your images is being looked at and get an idea about what others are looking at.
